googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your Idaho driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox6: Enter your Idaho driver license number. If you do not have a driver license, enter the last four digits of your social security number.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules: Any registered Idaho voter may request an absentee ballot and vote by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfSubmissionAddress:
Secretary of State  
P.O. Box 83720  
State Capitol Bldg.  
Boise, ID 83720‐0080
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsInPersonVoting: All Idaho voters are expected to show photo ID issued by the state of Idaho. The goal here is to prove that you live in Idaho. Acceptable forms of ID include an Idaho driver license, an Idaho state ID card, or a photo ID issued by any Idaho government agency. You can also show a student ID card issued by an Idaho high school or college or university.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmWarnings: The Local Election Office will compare your signature on your voted ballot to the one on your driver’s license.  If the signatures don't match, your ballot might be rejected.  Please sign carefully.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.year2020LegalChanges: Idaho voters can request a mail-in ballot online.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox7: You do not have to register with a party if you want to take part in that party’s primary election, caucus, or convention.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsOvr: You will need an Idaho ID to use Idaho's online voter registration system. If you do not have an Idaho ID, you can still register to vote by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsVbm: Idaho voters do not need to provide ID when voting by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Idaho you must:

  * be at least 18 years old
  * be a citizen of the United States
  * have resided in Idaho and in the county for 30 days prior to the day of election
  * not be serving a sentence of imprisonment for a felony. Your voting rights are restored once you have completed your sentence, probation, and parole.
